profileTypes.name: Curse of da Bad Moon Chart

description: Any Orc unit joined by a Warchanter may re-roll 1's To Hit and To Wound in close combat.
rules.name: Frenzy of Violence

description: A Forest Goblin Great Shaman mounted on an Arachnarok Spider with a Catchweb Spidershrine has Loremaster (Spells of da Spider God). In addition, he and any other friendly Wizard within 12" of the Arachnarok Spider adds +2 to their channelling attempts.
rules.name: Catchweb Spidershrine

characteristics.$text: Oh Dear!: The unit the jester is attached to suffers -1 To Hit in close combat this turn.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Nothing Happens: The Jester has no effect this turn.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: You Annoying Little...!: All enemy units in base contact with the Jester's unit suffer -1 To Hit in close combat this turn. This has no effect on units with Immunity (Psychology).
characteristics.name: Result

description:
A Goblin Jester is placed in the front rank of the unit he is bought for, and may never leave the unit.

Goblins are always encouraged by the presence of a Jester and gains a +1 bonus to their LD (on top of other rules such as Inspiring Presence) as long as the Jester is alive. Characters are not affected.

On the downside however, Goblins are always distracted by Jesters so every turn the unit passes its animosity test, roll another D6. On the roll of a 1 the unit may do nothing for the rest of the turn.

As Jesters are so energetic in battle it is almost impossible to hit the blighter in melee. Enemies must re-roll successful To Hit rolls against them in close combat.

At the start of each round of close combat in which a Goblin Jester is involved, roll a dice and consult the "You Annoying Little" table.
rules.name: Goblin Jester

description: Fanatics cannot be charged, but models can move into contact with them. Any unit that does so takes 2D6 S 5 Armour Piercing (1) hits. The Fanatic model is then removed, and the unit may carry on with its move.
rules.name: Force of Destruction

description:
Fanatics are not placed on the table at the start of the game as are other troops. Instead you must make a written note of any Night Goblin units that include Fanatics. These units are referred to as concealing units. The Fanatics count as being part of the concealing unit until they are released. Fanatics remain hidden, carried along by their fellows, until
they are ready to be pushed out towards the enemy. If a concealing unit flees or is destroyed, any Fanatics yet to be released are lost.
rules.name: Hide in units

description:
A Fanatic is removed immediately as a casualty when:

 It contacts a piece of terrain of any kind that's not open ground.
 It contacts another Fanatic (both Fanatics are removed).
 It moves off a table edge.
 It rolls a double for movement. This does not apply in the turn of release.
 Any unit moves into contact with the Fanatic.
rules.name: Out of Control

description: Fanatics must be released when a concealing unit comes to within 8" of the enemy or vice versa. The moving unit stops immediately (fliers land). Once the Fanatic's movement has been resolved, the unit can continue moving if the controlling player wishes, although chargers must complete their charge unless panicked. When a Fanatic is released, you may choose the direction in which it travels, and the point on the concealing unit from which it starts. Fanatics move 2D6" using the rules for Random Movement. After release, Fanatics are treated as individual units. In your subsequent turns they move in the Compulsory Moves subphase using Random Movement, but they always move in a random direction.
rules.name: Release the Fanatics!

description: If a Fanatic's move would bring it into contact with another unit, then he moves through rather than stopping. If the Fanatic's move would end within a unit, then he automatically bounces through it  place the Fanatic model 1" beyond the unit, in the direction he was moving. When a Fanatic moves through any unit it inflicts D6 S 5 Armour Piercing (1) hits.
rules.name: Splat!

description: Twackwheezer Puffshrooms replace the Fanatic's normal S 5 Hits. All models Hit must pass a T test or suffer a Wound which Ignores Armour Saves. This has no effect on Animated Constructs. In addition, all models within 6" of a Fanatic with this upgrade count as being in soft cover.
rules.name: Thwackwheezer Puffshrooms

description: Each Snotling base can make a single shooting attack in its Shooting phases, and as a stand and shoot reaction. An Explodin' Spore is a Throwing Weapon, hitting automatically and Ignores Armour saves.
rules.name: Explodin' Spores

profiles.name: Savage Orc Boar Boy Big 'Un Boss

selectionEntries.name: Savage Orc Boar Boy Big 'Un Boss

description: If the To Hit roll for a shooting attack made by a Spear Chukka is a 1 (before any modifiers are applied), then it misfires. Roll on the Stone Thrower Misfire table and apply the result to the Spear Chukka.
rules.name: Slipshod

description: At the end of any Close Combat phase in which a unit of Nasty Skulkers take part, they may choose to use their smoke bombs. On a 4+, the unit may disengage the combat by making a flee move. If they do so, the enemy cannot pursue them and they will rally automatically in their next turn.
rules.name: Puffball Smoke Bomb

description: If the unit flees, or if at any time there are only Squigs left alive in the unit with no Herders, the Squigs go wild, biting at anything nearby. All units within 2D6" (friend and foe) immediately take D6 S 5 hits. For every 5 Cave Squigs remaining when the Squigs Go Wild, add +1 to the number of hits caused. After damage is resolved, the Squig Herd is removed in its entirety.
rules.name: Squigs Go Wild

description: Instead of attacking normally, the whole unit can choose to vomit on the enemy. Each model inflicts one automatic S 5 hit which Ignores Armour Saves.
rules.name: Troll Vomit

description: Stone Trolls have Magic Resistance (2) and Natural Armour (5+).
rules.name: Stone Troll

description: River Trolls have River Strider and Marsh Strider. Additionally, enemies attempting to attack a River Troll in close combat suffer a -1 penalty on their To Hit rolls.
rules.name: River Troll

characteristics.$text:
Fire the Doom Diver Catapult as a stone thrower. However, no template is used. Instead, place the flying Doom Diver Goblin model on the target point, and then roll for scatter as you would for a stone thrower. After doing this, you may roll a D6 and move the Doom Diver Goblin model by that many inches in any direction. If any units are touched by the Doom Diver's base, then each must take D6 S 5 hits.

Should the artillery dice roll a misfire, roll a D6 and consult the Doom Diver Misfire table.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Destroyed!: The war machine is destroyed.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Disabled: The Doom Diver Catapult cannot shoot this turn or in the controlling player's next turn.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Skidmarks: The Doom Diver will hit the first thing along the path towards his chosen target point. If this is a piece of terrain he is removed immediately and inflicts no damage. If this is a unit (friend or foe) he will inflict D6 S 5 hits, with no armour saves allowed, before being removed.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Wild Shot!: The Doom Diver is fired D6x10" in a random direction. This roll determines the impact point for the Doom Diver  he is unable to move the impact point D6" in this case.
characteristics.name: Result

description: Any time a Pump Wagon rolls two or more 1's for its movement, it will not move as normal. Re-roll the Random Movement distance (including the extra dice if you were 'pumping harder'), but this time the Pump Wagon will move in a random direction. If the re-rolled movement also includes two or more 1's, then the Pump Wagon has crashed  remove it as a casualty. Otherwise, all Random Movement rules apply, except that a Pump Wagon halted by a friendly unit will inflict 2D6 Impact Hits on the unit that blocks its move.
rules.name: Too Pumped Up

description: Before moving a Pump Wagon you may declare that the crew are 'pumping harder'. If you do so, you must roll 3D6 for its random movement.
rules.name: Pump Harder Ladz!

description: You may take 1-2 Snotling Pump Wagons as a single Rare choice.
rules.name: Snotling Pump Wagon

description: If a Pump Wagon has an out-rigga then its Movement characteristic is increased to 3D6. Note that this means that if the crew decide to pump harder then you must roll 4D6 for the Pump Wagon's random movement.
rules.name: Out-rigga

description: If a Pump Wagon has a spiky roller then all its Impact Hits have +1 S.
rules.name: Spiky Roller

description: If a Pump Wagon has giant explodin' spores, the first set of Impact Hits it inflicts in the game Ignores Armour saves.
rules.name: Giant Explodin' Spores

description: A Pump Wagon fitted with flappas only has to take Dangerous Terrain tests if they end their move in Dangerous Terrain.
rules.name: Flappas

description: Mangler Squigs must take a Dangerous Terrain test if they move over any of the following types of terrain: Forests, Marshland, Obstacles or Mystical Monuments. If their move would take them into contact with a Building, Impassable Terrain or off a table edge then they must take a Dangerous Terrain test and will stop 1" short of the obstruction.
rules.name: Watch Out!

description:
If the Mangler Squigs' move would bring them into contact with another unit, then they move through rather than stopping. If the Mangler Squigs' move would end within a unit, then they automatically bounce through it  place the Mangler Squigs 1" beyond the unit, in the direction in which they were moving.

When Mangler Squigs move through a unit (friend or foe) they inflict 2D6 S 6 hits.
rules.name: Ker-splat!

description: Mangler Squigs that make a Ker-Splat! attack Go Crazy. Once Mangler Squigs have Gone Crazy they will move in a random direction when they move in the Compulsory Moves sub-phase.
rules.name: Gone Crazy!

description: Mangler Squigs cannot be charged, but models can move into contact with them. Any unit that moves into contact with Mangler Squigs takes 2D6 S 6 hits for moving into the Squigs and a further D6 S 6 hits. The Mangler Squig model is then removed, and the unit may carry on with its move.
rules.name: Force of Total Destruction

description:
Mangler Squigs are removed as a casualty when:
 They contact other Mangler Squigs (both Mangler Squigs are removed as casualties).
 They have gone crazy and rolled a triple for movement. This represents the Great Squigs ripping themselves to pieces or some other comic, yet fatal mishap.
 Any unit moves into contact with the Mangler Squigs  see the Force of Total Destruction rule.
rules.name: Completely Out of Control

characteristics.$text: Acid Guts: Every model within 6" of the Squig Gobba (including the Night Goblin Tenders) takes a Strength 2 Hit which Ignores Armour saves.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Stomach Rumblings: Nothing happens this turn, but you must instead roll 4D6 when firing the Squig Gobba next shooting phase.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Squig Torrent: This is resolved as a shot from a Stone Thrower that uses the large template with a range of 36". Any model covered by the template suffers a S 4 hit. If a misfire is rolled, the Squig Gobba suffers D3 Wounds and the shot is wasted.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Intestinal Explosion: The Squig Gobba immediately makes a Breath Weapon Attack at S 6. After the attack has been resolved, the Squig Gobba suffers D3 Wounds.
characteristics.name: Result

description: The Squig Gobba cannot move after it has been deployed except pivoting on the spot. It may not pursue an enemy it defeats in combat. If the Squig Gobba breaks from combat, it is automatically destroyed.
rules.name: Tied Down

description: The Squig Gobba may fire in the Shooting Phase as long as as least one Night Goblin Tender remains and it is not in close combat. When firing the Squig Gobba, roll 3D6 and consult the Squig Gobba Table.
rules.name: Squig Gobba

description: When the Colossal Squig's random movement brings it into contact with a unit, either friend or foe, it will attack it normally as if it were an enemy, and counts as charging that unit. This combat will continue until resolved normally.
rules.name: Dinner's Dinner!

description: When a Colossal Squig is removed as a casualty, every model in base contact with it suffers an automatic S 3 hit.
rules.name: Falls Apart

description: If it is possible for a Rogue Idol to charge an enemy it must do so (however if multiple targets are within charge range, its player may pick which to attack). At the start of any turn that a Rogue Idol is not able to charge or is not already in combat, its player must roll a D6. On a roll of a 1 it must instead charge a friendly unit if one is available to charge, and a single round of combat is fought as normal, after which the Rogue Idol is pushed 1" back if the charged unit does not break. If no friendly units are available to charge the Rogue Idol may do nothing this turn.
rules.name: Da Big Un

characteristics.$text: Smother: The target suffers D3 Wounds which Ignores Armour saves. This has no effect on Animated Constructs. In addition, the target may not make any attacks until the Troll Hag is either slain or rolls a different result on its special attack table.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Squish: The model is removed as a casualty.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Suck out its Marrow: The unit suffers D6 S 5 hits. For every wound the target loses, the Troll Hag gains one, up to its starting number.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Pick up and...: The Troll Hag grabs a single Character in base contact from the target unit (Troll Hag's choice). The Troll Hag grabs the model and the player rolls a D6 on the Pick up and... Table to see what happens next.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Grind its Bones: The Troll Hag may target a single model in base contact. This model suffers a single S 6 hit with Multiple Wounds (D3).
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Crush with Stump: All models in base contact, friend or foe, suffer a S 6 hit.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Mother: The target takes a single S 6 hit with Multiple Wounds (D3). If the target survives the attack, it may not attack until the start of your next turn.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text:
Mither: Neither the Troll Hag nor the target actually fight if they have not already done so this round. The Troll Hag automatically wins the combat by 2 points or more. This result has no effect against Animated Constructs.

The target has its WS reduced to 1 until the end of the next turn. This has no effect on Animated Constructs.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Toss Back: The victim suffers D3 S 6 Hits which Ignores Armour saves, and D6 S 3 hits are inflicted on the unit (save as normal).
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Send Packing: The Troll Hag will attempt to throw the victim into the nearest water feature (such as a river, marsh or swamp) within 12". The victim is automatically removed as a casualty unless they have Aquatic in which case the model lands unharmed in the water. If no water feature is in range, treat this as a Throw Back into Combat result instead.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Stuff into Net: The model is effectively removed as a casualty and can do nothing whilst in the bag, but if the Troll Hag should be slain, any enemy trapped in its bag are freed at the end of the battle, and no longer counts as casualties.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Gobble: The model is removed as a casualty.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Pick Another: Treat the attack as if the Troll Hag had rolled the Stuff into Net result, and then choose another victim. Roll again on this table to see what the Troll Hag does with it.
characteristics.name: Result

description: Enemies attempting to attack a Giant River Troll Hag in close combat suffer a -1 penalty to their To Hit rolls.
rules.name: Slimy Shanks

description: This is a Breath Weapon, with a S of 3 and Ignores Armour saves. A unit that takes casualties due to this attack has its LD reduced by the number of casualties suffered the next time it takes a Panic test, after which it returns to normal.
rules.name: Swamp Breath

description: To determine what happens in each Close Combat phase, pick a unit in base contact with the Troll Hag and roll a D6 on one of the tables. Which table you use depends on the size of the Troll Hag's victim. If no suitable target is in base contact, roll again on the chart until you get another result. Use the Tiddlers chart when fighting Infantry, Cavalry, War Beasts or Swarms. Use the Whoppers chart when fighting Monsters, Monstrous Beasts, Monstrous Infantry, Monstrous Cavalry, Chariots, War Machines, and Shrines.
rules.name: Troll Hag Special Attacks

description: Unless she is within a water feature of any type (including rivers, marshes, swamps, etc), the Giant River Troll Hag hasStupidity. If the test is failed and there is one or more water features on the table, the Troll Hag moves towards the closest of these instead of straight forwards.
rules.name: Water Wise

description: The models in a unit of Night Goblin Squig Hunters may be armed with number of different weapons. This is represented by including one or more models with that weapon in the unit. If the unit includes Nets the unit follows the rules for Netters. If the unit includes Clubs all models fight with +1 S in close combat. If the unit includes Prodders all models gain Fight in Extra Ranks (1).
rules.name: Hunting Team

characteristics.$text: Fight in Extra Ranks (1). Requires Two Hands.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: At the start of your movement phase, as long as it is not in close combat or fleeing, you can say that this unit is harvesting mooncap mushrooms. If you do so, it cannot move in that movement phase, but you can roll a D6. On a 2+, pick a friendly Night Goblin unit (of any type) within 6" of this unit. This unit gains Frenzy until the start of your next turn.
rules.name: Mooncap Mushrooms

description: Sneaky Snufflers consist of a Night Goblin and a Snufflesquig mounted on the same base. They follow the split profile rules for Cavalry.
rules.name: Snufflesquig

description: Instead of attacking normally, this model can choose to vomit on the enemy. It inflicts D6 automatic S 6 hits which Ignores Armour Saves.
rules.name: Copious Troll Vomit

characteristics.$text: Get 'Em: Inflict D6 S 3 hits on the closest friendly unit that has 5 or more models, is subject to Animosity, and is within 3". The victim (if there is one) then inflicts D6 S 3 hits back. Neither unit can charge or move in the Movement phase, cast spells, nor shoot this turn. If the victim has not yet taken an Animosity test, then it does not do so this turn. If there isn't an eligible victim, the unit will Squabble instead. Wounds caused by the Get 'Em result never cause Panic tests.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Squabble: If it is possible to do so, the unit must declare a charge against the closest enemy unit in the Charge sub-phase. If the unit is unable to declare a charge, then the unit may not move in the Movement phase, cast spells nor shoot this turn.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: We'll Show 'Em: Pivot the unit on the spot to face the nearest visible enemy unit, and then make a full (non-march) move in a straight line towards it. If there is no visible enemy, the unit must move straight ahead instead. If it is impossible for the unit to pivot to face the closest enemy, it will pivot towards it as far as it can, and will then move as far forward as it can while still keeping the enemy within its forward arc. After the move is complete the unit must declare a charge in the Charge sub-phase against the closest visible enemy unit, if it is possible to do so. If the unit cannot declare a charge then it may carry on with the rest of its turn normally, as if it had not yet moved this turn.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Fzzzzzzap!: Resolve the effects as if the Shaman had cast the Gaze of Mork spell and then deduct D3 dice from the power pool.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: "Yuuurgh!": The Shaman is subject to Frenzy and Stupidity for the rest of the game, although he may never lose his Frenzy. He may cast no further spells this turn.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: "I've Forgot!": The Shaman may not cast this spell for the rest of the game. In addition, the resulting brainstorm permanently reduces his Wizard Level by 1 (to a minimum of 0) and he may not cast any further spells this phase.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: "Me 'Ead 'Urts!": All greenskins (friend or foe) within 12" that are capable of channeling power or dispel dice suffer a S 4 hit which Ignores Armour saves. In addition, D6 dice are lost from the pool.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: "I Fink I'm Gonna...": The Shaman suffers a S 10 hit and all Greenskin units (friend or foe) within 12" suffer D6 S 5 hits which Ignores Armour saves. In addition, D6 dice are lost from the pool.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: 'Eadbang!: Place the large round template over the Shaman before removing him from play. Any model under the template must pass a T test or also be killed outright with no armour saves allowed. In addition, D6 dice are lost from the power pool.
characteristics.name: Result

description: Any unit within range of Azhag's Inspiring Presence that fails an Animosity test must immediately re-roll the dice.
rules.name: Get on Wiv it!

characteristics.$text: Medium Armour. The 'Ard Armour gives Azhag Ward save (5+).
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: The crown makes Azhag a Level 2 Wizard who uses spells from the Lore of Death. In addition, Azhag suffers from Stupidity.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Two/Additional Hand Weapons. The Slashas allow Azhag to re-roll failed To Hit rolls in the first round of combat.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: The Daemon Staff gives Azhag +1 to cast spells.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: Wurrzag's Warpaint gives him a Ward save (5+).
rules.name: Warpaint of Wurrzag

description: Being Mork's current favourite, Wurrzag adds +1 to cast spells, and may re-roll miscast results.
rules.name: Mork's Favorite

characteristics.$text: Bound spell (power level 5). The Bonewood Staff contains the Wurrzag's Revenge spell.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Affects all enemy Wizards in range of Wurrzag. Roll a D6 for each Wizard that is affected. On a roll of 1-5 they shake off the spell, but on a roll of 6 they are turned into a Squiggly Beast and removed as a casualty, along with any mount they have, with no saves of any kind allowed. In addition, you may store one extra dice in Wizzbang the Power Squig for each Wizard that is transformed.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Bound spell (power level 3). The Baleful Mask contains the Gaze of Mork spell from Spells of da Big Waaagh!.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: At the end of either player's Magic phase, you can store one unused dice from your pool in the Power Squig. At the start of the next Magic phase, you must add this extra dice to your power or dispel pool as appropriate.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: At the start of the game, before deployment, roll a D6 for each enemy unit. On a roll of 6, that unit has been delayed. Affected units do not deploy as normal, but instead enter play as reinforcements in the Movement phase of their first turn.
rules.name: Sneaky Schemes

description: Any friendly Night Goblin unit that chooses to flee as a charge reaction and subsequently rallies at the beginning of its next turn may reform as normal, but is then also free to move during the Remaining Moves sub-phase. The unit is also free to shoot as normal (but it always counts as having moved).
rules.name: Tricksy Traps

characteristics.$text: The Prodder contains a Bound Spell (power level 5).
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Causes D3 S 6 hits which Ignores Armour saves. The number of hits is increased to D6 if Skarsnik is within a Night Goblin unit with at least 5 models, not including Skarsnik.
characteristics.name: Details

description: Skarsnik and Gobbla are treated as a single infantry model with a single set of wounds. Gobbla's profile is used only when he attacks.
rules.name: Gobbla

description: The Black Gobbo may re-roll all failed rolls To Hit when fighting Dwarfs. In addition, the Black Gobbo and any unit he accompanies are Stubborn when they are in base contact with any Dwarf.
rules.name: Really Hates Dwarfs

characteristics.$text: The protective runes within the beard confer a Ward save (6+) to the Black Gobbo.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: This hood causes units of Night Goblins to treat the Black Gobbo as if he had LD 9.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: The wearer of the belt may reroll any single D6 roll once per game that affects him directly.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

profiles.name: Belt Buckle of Durzik Al Drazh

selectionEntries.name: Belt Buckle of Durzik Al Drazh

characteristics.$text: If the Black Gobbo scores a hit against an enemy who has a magic weapon, the enemy's magic weapon is destroyed on the roll of a 4+. In addition, the axe confers +1 A to the wielder.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: Friendly units within 18" of Gorbad that fail an Animosity test add his current number of Wounds to their roll on the Animosity table.
rules.name: Da Great Leader

description: Gorbad must be army's General, and he also has the "Hold Your Ground" ability like a Battle Standard. In addition, the range of Gorbad's Inspiring Presence and Hold Your Ground! Abilities is increased from 12" to 18". Note that you may not choose a separate Battle Standard in an army that includes Gorbad.
rules.name: Da Boss 'as a Plan!

description: An Orc & Goblin army that includes Gorbad may upgrade any number of units of Orc Boyz and/or Orc Boar Boyz to Big 'Uns.
rules.name: Orcs are da Best

characteristics.$text: When using Morglor the Mangler Gorbad gains Always Strikes First, Multiple Wounds (D3) and Ignores Armour saves.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: Skragrott can always choose to re-roll any number of dice when determining how far the template from the Curse of da Bad Moon spell moves.
rules.name: The Moon King's Entreaty

characteristics.$text: If an enemy model suffers one or more unsaved Wounds from Da Moon Onna Stikk, they must pass a T test at the start of each Movement phase or suffer 1 additional Wound with no saves allowed.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: The Moon King's Crown gives Skragrott +1 to cast spells and Ward Save (4+).
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: The Babbling Wand allows Skragrott to re-roll any failed Channelling rolls.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: If your army includes Morglum, he must be the Army General.
rules.name: Natural Leader

characteristics.$text: Heavy Armour. This armour gives Morglum Ward save (4+). However, if he rolls a 1 when rolling his ward save the number of Wounds suffered is doubled.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Two/Additional Hand Weapons. Whenever Morglum's To Hit roll on a D6 is higher than his target's WS, the attack will not only hit regardless of the score normally needed to hit, but will also be multipled into 2 Hits.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: This amulet gives Grumlok +1 S and Gazbag +1 to cast spells.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: All friendly units within 12" of Gordrakk gain Devastating Charge.
rules.name: Voice of Gork

characteristics.$text: Two/Additional Hand Weapons. When targeting a Wizard in close combat, Gordrakk may re-roll failed rolls To Hit and gains Multiple Wounds (D3). When targeting a Character that is not a Wizard in close combat, Gordrakk may reroll failed rolls To Wound and gains Killing Blow.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Heavy Armour and Shield. This armour gives Gorfang Magic Resistance (2).
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: The Red Fang gives the wielder +1 A and +1 To Hit in close combat.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: Grimgor must always be accompanied by his grizzled Black Orc bodyguard, and may join no other unit. The Immortulz are a unit of Black Orcs with an additional +1 WS. Grimgor must deploy with this unit and may not leave it. No other character may join the unit. As long as Grimgor is alive, the Immortulz have Hatred.
rules.name: Da Immortulz

description: If your army includes Grimgor, he must be the Army General.
rules.name: He's da Boss

characteristics.$text: The axe grants Grimgor Always Strikes First.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: The Blood-forged Armour gives a 5+ ward save.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: The Eye gives Grimgor Magic Resistance (1).
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: Grom has the Waaagh! rule. When Grom calls a Waaagh!, in addition to the units that would normally be affected, every unit of five or more Goblins, Goblin Wolf Riders, Night Goblins, Forest Goblins and Forest Goblin Spider Riders in the army adds +1 to its combat resolution for the rest of the player turn.
rules.name: Grom's Waaagh!

description: As long as Grom is alive, all units in his army ignore Fear Elves.
rules.name: Eats Elves for Breakfast

description: If your army includes Grom, he must be the Army General. In addition you may not include any Orc, Savage Orc or Black Orc Lords if Grom is your General. An army containing Grom must include at least one unit of Goblins.
rules.name: Goblin General

characteristics.$text: Great Weapon. Attacks made with this axe have Killing Blow. In addition, against Elves (of any kind), Grom's Axe will cause a Killing Blow on the To Wound roll of 5+.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: Niblet counts as the army's Battle Standard Bearer. Niblet is part of the chariot model and, although he can attack, he can never be engaged separately or issue or accept challenges. If the chariot is destroyed, then Niblet and the banner are lost too.
rules.name: Niblet

characteristics.$text: The Lucky Banner allows Grom to re-roll failed armour and Ward saves.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: Badruk has Killing Blow. In addition, he causes a Killing Blow on the To Wound roll of a 5+ rather than a 6.
rules.name: Executioner's Strike

characteristics.$text: One use only. Once per battle, Badruk can cause one enemy model fighting him in close combat to miss with all his normal attacks. He may wait until after the enemy has rolled to hit to decide to use it, but must choose before he rolls To Wound.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Great Weapon. The Whacker gives Bigfeet Always Strikes First and allows him to re-roll failed To Wound rolls.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: If Borgut fights in a challenge, then at the beginning of the first Close Combat phase of the challenge, he can smash his thick Orc skull into the face of his opponent. This is in addition to his normal attacks, and is resolved before any other attacks in the challenge. If this attack inflicts an unsaved Wound, the target is reduced to WS 1 and gains Always Strike Last for the rest of the Close Combat phase. If this mighty 'eadbutt kills his opponent, Borgut can still make his remaining attacks to calculate overkill for the purposes of combat resolution.
rules.name: The Facebeater

description: If your army includes Grimgor, then you may never deploy Borgut further than 6" from him when setting up your army.
rules.name: Keep Your Enemies Closer

description: If Borgut is included in your army, then you may upgrade one additional unit of Orc Boyz into Big 'Uns. Borgut must deploy and remain with this unit for the entirety of the battle.
rules.name: Do as I say and wot I do

characteristics.$text: This armour gives Borgut an Armour save that cannot be improved.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Two/Additional Hand Weapons. This massive axe allows Borgut to re-roll failed armour saves.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: The Deff Creepers are a unit of Forest Goblin Spider Riders with Ambushers, Devastating Charge and Hatred (Empire). In addition, they cause Fear in any turn that they successfully charge into combat. Snagla must set up with this unit and may not leave it. No other character may join the unit.
rules.name: Deff Creepers

characteristics.$text: Poisoned Attacks. Multiple Wounds (D3). Quick To Fire. One use only.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: Da Howlerz are a unit of Goblin Wolf Riders with an additional +1 BS and Quick to Fire. Gitilla must set up with this unit and may not leave it. No other character may join the unit.
rules.name: Da Howlerz

characteristics.$text: The Stinky Pelt grants Gitilla Natural Armour (5+).
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: Gitilla, and any unit he is with, can choose to re-roll any Pursuit or Flee rolls they make.
rules.name: Ulda the Great Wolf

selectionEntryGroups.name: Spells from the Lore of the Bad Moon
Spells from the Lore of the Bad Moon
Spells from the Lore of the Bad Moon
Spells from the Lore of the Bad Moon
Spells from the Lore of the Big Waaagh!
Spells from the Lore of the Big Waaagh!
Spells from the Lore of the Big Waaagh!
Spells from the Lore of the Big Waaagh!
Spells from the Lore of the Savage Waaagh!
Spells from the Lore of the Savage Waaagh!
Spells from the Lore of the Savage Waaagh!
Spells from the Lore of the Savage Waaagh!
Spells from the Lore of the Little Waaagh!
Spells from the Lore of the Little Waaagh!
Spells from the Lore of the Little Waaagh!
Spells from the Lore of the Little Waaagh!
Spells from the Lore of the Spider God
Spells from the Lore of the Spider God
Spells from the Lore of the Spider God
Spells from the Lore of the Spider God

characteristics.$text: The Skull Wand unleashes a curse on a single enemy model that is in base contact with the bearer at the start of the Close Combat phase. The victim must pass a LD test (using its own, unmodified, LD) or be slain instantly, with no save of any kind allowed. In addition, the bearer of the Skull Wand causes Terror.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Goblins (of any type) only. At the start of each of your Magic phases, the Staff of Sneaky Stealin' allows you to remove one dice from the opponent's Dispel dice pool and add it to your own Power dice pool.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Savage Orc Shamans and Savage Orc Great Shamans only. The Head Iincreases the Warpaint save of the bearer and any unit he joins from by +1.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Orcs (of any type) only. At the start of your magic phase, the Idol of Mork adds one power dice to your power pool for every friendly Orc unit (any type) with 10 or more Unit Strength in combat within 24" if the bearer. However, it removes one power dice from your power pool for every friendly fleeing Orc (any type) with 10 or more Unit Strength unit within 24" of the bearer.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: One use only. When casting a spell, the bearer of the Dangly Wotnotz may use to add +1 to the result of one of the dice rolled. This may cause Ultimate Power or prevent a Miscast.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: The bearer of Ditto's Double Doin' Doodahs may choose to attempt to cast one of their spells twice per Magic phase.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Buzgob's Knobbly Staff allows the wielder to reroll all power dice used to cast a spell once per Magic phase (before rolling any Ultimate Power dice). This cannot be used if a miscast is rolled.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: The Staff of Baduum gives the bearer a +1 bonus to the result of their spell casting attempts. However, in case a Miscast is rolled, add 1 to the result rolled on the Miscast table.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Savage Orc only. If the wearer of the Waaagh! Paint is in close combat at the start of your Magic phase, they receive +2 to the result of their spell casting attempts.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: One use only. The horn can be used at the start of any of your turns. When this horn is sounded, all friendly units within 24" receive +1 LD and all enemy units within 24" suffer a -1 penalty to their LD until the end of the turn.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Orcs (of any type) on foot only. The wearer of Bigged's 'Ed Kickin' Boots gains Stomp.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Night Goblins only. The Pipes of Doom can be used the start of the Shooting Phase. All enemy War Beasts, Cavalry, Monstrous Beasts, Monstrous Cavalry, Chariots (except those that do not have any mounts pulling them) and Monsters within 12" must take a Panic test.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Common Orcs and Black Orcs only. War Boar. The Ironback Boar has S 4 and Impact Hits (D3).
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Orcs (of any type) only. The 'Eadbuttin' 'At gives the wearer +1 A with Always Strikes First and Killing Blow in challenges. This attack does not benefit from any other weapon rules the wearer might have.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Savage Orcs only. All close combat attacks made against the bearer of the Effigy of Mork suffer -1 To Hit.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Goblins (of any type) only. No models in base contact with the wear of the Tricksy Trinket may take Ward Saves.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Night Goblins only. One use only. If the model bearing the Mad Cap Mushrooms is in a unit containing one or more Night Goblin Fanatics, they may choose to give them each Mad Cap Mushroom before they are released. Each Fanatic from this unit inflicts an additional D6 Hits on any unit they move into base contact with this turn.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Bound Spell, Power Level 4. Nibbla's 'Itty Ring contains the 'Eadbutt spell from the Spells of the Big Waaagh! Roll a D6 each time it has successfully been cast; on the roll of a 1, the spell is resolved against the caster itself.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Common Orcs and Black Orcs only. The model wearing Imbad's Iron Gnashas gains +1 A with Killing Blow. This attack does not benefit from any other weapon rules the wearer might have.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Goblins only. If the bearer of the Brimstone Bauble is slain in close combat, all units in base contact suffer D6 S 6 Hits, distributed as Hits from shooting. Any Wounds caused count towards combat resolution.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Roll a D6 for the bearer of Guzzla's Battle Brew at the start of the game and consult the battle brew table to see what effect it has.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: The model gains Hatred and Frenzy.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Model on foot only. Before deployment, roll a D6. On 4+, the bearer of Maad's Map and one unit they must join with gain Scouts. On a 1- 3, the unit has gotten lost and gains Ambushers instead.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Heavy Armour. The wearer has +D3 T. Roll to determine the armour's effectiveness the first time the wearer is hit each turn, and use the result for the rest of the turn. In addition, the wearer has Impact Hits (D6).
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Shield. The Ironskin Shield gives the bearer Ward Save (5+).
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Medium armour. The Armour of Protectyness gives the wearer Regeneration (5+).
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Medium armour. The Armour of Mork gives the wearer Magic Resistance (2).
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Goblins only. Nobbla's Helmet gives the wearer Ward save (6+).
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Shield. Ugbrag's Lucky Shield makes the wearer ignore the first Wounding Hit suffered in the game.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Shield. For each To Hit roll of a 1 against the bearer, the Spiteful Shield inflicts a S 5 Hit against the model that struck the blow.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: A unit with Mork's War Banner has Magic Resistance (D6). Roll to determine the effectiveness of the banner the first time the unit needs to take any saving throws against spells in a turn. The result is used for all such saves made that turn. In addition, all magic items belonging to enemy models that are in base contact with the bearer do not work and will count as mundane versions of the same type.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text:
Forest Goblin Big Boss only. Models in a unit with the Spider Banner, including the bearer, have Poisoned
Attacks. Models that already have Poisoned Attacks will automatically wound on To Hit rolls of 6.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Night Goblin Big Boss only. Night Goblin models in a unit with the Bad Moon banner are Stubborn. In addition, the banner shrouds the unit in darkness. The bearer and any unit he joins count as being in soft cover, and any enemy model that charges into base contact with the bearer or the unit must take a Dangerous Terrain test.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Common Goblins only. All Common Goblins within 12" of Rowdy Grott's Big Red Raggedy Banner may roll 3D6 for their Break Tests and Panic tests and discard the highest result.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

profiles.name: Rowdy Grott's Big Red Raggedy Banner

selectionEntries.name: Rowdy Grott's Big Red Raggedy Banner

characteristics.$text: Orcs (of any type) only. The unit carrying Gork's Waaagh! Banner adds D6" to its charge distance. If the charge is failed, the unit will move forward its normal failed charge distance.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: The unit carrying Guff's Flag has Immunity (Psychology).
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: One use only. Nogg's Banner of Butchery may be used at the start of any close combat phase. All models in the unit (except mounts) carrying the Banner of Butchery gain +1 A for the remainder of the close combat phase.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: The carrying the Bashin' Flag of Bork ignores their first failed Animosity roll of the game  it passes the test instead.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: The unit carrying the Evil Sun Banner may re-roll any failed Animosity tests.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Roll a D6 at the start of each round of combat  the wielder of this weapon adds that number to both his A and S in that round. The bearer's WS is lowered by an amount equal to half the dice roll.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: The wielder of this weapon has Armour Piercing (1), and adds +1 to his A in close combat. This bonus is doubled if the wielder is in base contact with a model from the Warhammer Armies: Dwarfs. In addition, the wielder causes Fear in models from the Dwarf army book.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Common Orcs on foot only. The wielder of Basha's Bloodaxe gains Frenzy. However, they get +D6 Attacks (rolled before making their Attacks) and can never lose their Frenzy.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Common Orcs only. All hits from Warboss Ironclaw's Waaagh! Cleave Wound automatically with Ignores Armour Saves.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Shaga's Screaming Sword gives the wielder +1 S and +1 A for each enemy character within 12".
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Basha's Big Axe of Bashin' gives wielder +1 A.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Fumpa's Club of Fumpin' gives the wielder Quell Animosity.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Hacka's Sword of Hackin' makes the wielder always Hit any opponent on roll of a 2+.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: All hits with Kleeva's Cleaver of Cleavage Wound automatically. Armour saves are modified by the S of the bearer.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Great weapon. Krumpa's Club of Crumpin' gives the wielder Ignores Armour Saves.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Martog's Best Basha gives the wielder +1 WS and +1 I.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Duffa's Club of Duffin' gives the wielder +3 A in the first round of close combat.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Orcs (of any type) only. Mounted characters only. Spear. On any turn that they charge, Porko's Pigstikka gives the wielder +1 A for each rank that the unit they are attacking has.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Ulag's Ak'rit Axes allows the wielder to re-roll any failed To Hit rolls.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Any model Wounded (but not slain) by Kurbog's Curmudgeonly Clobbera may not attack this close combat phase. If they have already attacked this close combat phase, they may not attack in the next close combat phase.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Goblins (of any type) only. The Backstabber's Blade gives the wielder Poisoned Attacks. In addition, they get +1 S if they attack the enemy to their flank, or +2 S if they attack the enemy in their rear.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Goblins (of any type) only. The Sneaky Skewerer gives the wielder +1 To Hit and Killing Blow.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Goblins (of any type) only. Lucky's Dirk gives the wielder +1 S for each enemy Magic Item in base contact.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: An Infantry Character model which suffers an unsaved Wound (but is not slain) by Owzat's Club of Smackin' is immediately knocked clean out of combat and suffers a S 4 Hit. Move the model D6" backwards, stopping at least 1" away from other units or impassable terrain.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: One use only. Wollopa's One Hit Wunda may be used at the start of any close combat phase when it is the wielder's turn to attack. The wielder may replace all its normal Attacks with a special attack that is resolved at +3 S with Heroic Killing Blow.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Any unit joined by the bearer of the Sword of Bork that fails their Animosity test may roll 2D6 on the Animosity table and discard the lowest result.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: War Beasts, Monstrous Beasts, Monsters, Cavalry mounts, Monstrous Cavalry mounts and beasts pulling chariots require 6's to hit the bearer. In addition, the wearer can attempt to take control of any one creature belonging to the above Troop Types at the start of each close combat phase. Each player roll a D6 and add the unmodified LD of the wearer of the Collar and the beast he is trying to control. If the Orc player scores equal or higher, he takes control of the beast who will now attack any friendly models in base contact for the remainder of the close combat phase. If the Orc player scores lower, the beast may act normally this turn.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Warboss Umm's Best Big Boss's 'At gives the wearer Ward Save (4+). However, if the wearer fails its Ward save at any point, it will no longer have any effect from the start of the next player turn.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

profiles.name: Warboss Umm's Best Big Boss's At

selectionEntries.name: Warboss Umm's Best Big Boss's At

characteristics.$text: When the bearer of the Amulet of Protectyness suffers a Wound, they count as having the same armour and Ward save as the model that caused the Wound.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Sizzla's Shiny Baubles can be used against any successfully cast enemy spell that targets the bearer or the unit they are with. Roll a D6; on 1-3 nothing happens; on a 4+ the spell is reflected back at the caster and their unit and affects them instead, following all the normal rules for the spell. The original caster may then attempt to dispel their own spell using any remaining power dice.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Instead of making a normal dispel attempt, the wearer of the Glowy Green Amulet may attempt to nullify any enemy spell cast at the bearer or the unit they are with by a rolling a number of dice equal to the number of dice used to cast the spell. As long as no 1's are rolled, the spell is dispelled. However, if one or more 1's are rolled, the spell gets through as the Amulet overloads and explodes, killing the wearer outright (with no saves of any kind allowed).
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Savage Orcs only. The wearer of the Magical Warpaint may re-roll failed Ward Saves.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description:
Animosity is represented by an Animosity test. This test is taken in the Start of Turn sub-phase during each of your turns, by every unit that is subject to Animosity, with the following restrictions:

 Units only test if they contain at least 5 models.

 Units engaged in close combat don't test.

 Units garrisoning a building don't test.

 Units fleeing or currently off the battlefield don't test.

Roll a D6 for each eligible unit. If the dice roll is a 2 or more, the unit behaves normally this turn. If the roll is a 1, however, the unit has failed its Animosity test and must roll on the Animosity table and apply the result immediately.
sharedRules.name: Animosity

description: Models with this rule treat Goblins and Snotlings of all types as Expendable.
sharedRules.name: Size Matters

description: Models with this rule treat models from Warhammer: High Elves, Dark Elves and Wood Elves rule as causing Fear against them.
sharedRules.name: Fear Elves

description: If a Warboss is your Army General, then once per game he may call a Waaagh! The Waaagh! may only be called if the Warboss first declares a charge, and must be announced immediately after making the charge declaration, before any charge reaction takes place. In the turn a Waaagh! is called, every unit of five or more Orcs (of any type) in the army adds +1 to its combat resolution for the rest of the player turn. The General himself, and any unit he accompanies, adds +D3 to their combat resolution instead.
sharedRules.name: Waaagh!

description: A mount with this rule receives Strength Bonus (2) during the turn in which it charged into combat.
sharedRules.name: Tusker Charge

description: Models wearing Warpaint gain Ward save (6+).
sharedRules.name: Warpaint

description: At the start of each round of close combat, models with this rule can choose which of their weapons (including hand weapon and shield) they wish to fight with. If a Black Orc character has a magic weapon, he loses the benefit of this rule.
sharedRules.name: Armed to da Teef

description: If a Black Orc character is in a unit that fails an Animosity test, he immediately inflicts D6 hits at his base S on his unit, distributed as shooting attacks. After removing casualties, the unit is treated as if the Animosity test was passed. These hits cannot be allocated to the Black Orc character, and do not cause a Panic test.
sharedRules.name: Quell Animosity

description: An Orc Bully counts as an extra crew member (and an extra wound) for the war machine, and is always the last model to be removed. Orc Bullies have Choppas. In addition, while the Bully is still alive, their unit gains Size Matters.
sharedRules.name: Orc Bully

description: Models with this rule treat ungarrisoned buildings as open terrain for the purposes of movement. They may not finish their movement inside or on top of an ungarrisoned building.
sharedRules.name: Wall-crawler

description: Unlike other cavalry, Spider Riders do not have to dismount before assaulting a building, meaning the Giant Spiders are allowed to attack during the assault. Each Spider Rider and his mount count as a single model when determining the number of models that fight in a building assault. Note that Spider Riders still cannot garrison a building.
sharedRules.name: Creeping Assault

description: When fighting MI, MB, MC or Mo; before rolling to hit, nominate one of the Arachnarok's attacks to be made with the Venom Surge, and roll it separately. In addition to being Poisoned, this attack causes Multiple Wounds (D6).
sharedRules.name: Venom Surge

description: Each time they attempt to cast a spell, after the casting dice have been rolled a Night Goblin Shaman may eat a Magic Mushroom. This adds D6 to the casting result. This dice does not count as a power dice, and cannot contribute to Unlimited Power. However, if you roll a 1 on this dice you must roll a further D6. On a roll of 4+ nothing else happens, but on a roll of 1-3 the Shaman suffers a wound with no armour saves allowed, and the spell automatically fails.
sharedRules.name: Magic Mushrooms

description: Characters cannot join this unit.
sharedRules.name: Obnoxious

description: The only unit a Night Goblin character mounted on a Great Cave Squig is allowed to join is a Squig Hopper unit. He is allowed to do this even though characters are not normally allowed to join Squig Hopper units.
sharedRules.name: Loners

description: Forest Goblin Shamans may re-roll one dice when casting spells. However, any time they Miscast, they will also count as having failed a Stupidity test (if they survive).
sharedRules.name: Spider Venom

description: A unit of Savage Orcs may be upgraded to include Big Stabbas. A unit of Savage Orcs may be upgraded to include Big Stabbas. This is represented by upgrading two models and by including one or more Big Stabba models in the unit. A Big Stabba is mounted on two Infantry bases and must be placed to cover both the first and second rank of the unit, but is otherwise equipped like the rest of the unit. Each Big Stabba model causes D3 Impact Hits with Multple Wounds (D3). Big Stabbas are always the last models to be removed as casualties; the weapons are picked up by other Savage Orcs in the unit (excluding any Command Group models) should they be slain.
sharedRules.name: Big Stabba

description: You may upgrade a single unit (not one each) in your army to Big 'Uns.
sharedRules.name: Big 'Uns

description: If an Orc or Goblin Shaman rolls a Miscast, they roll 2D6 on the WAAAGH! Miscast table instead of the normal Miscast Table used by other wizards.
sharedRules.name: WAAAGH! Miscast

description: A unit of Night Goblins may be upgraded to include one or more models of Netters. This is represented by including one or more Netter models in the unit. Netters are equipped and may fight like the rest of the unit. At the start of each round of close combat, the Netters must attempt to entangle one of the units they are fighting in their front arc. Roll a D3 for each of the first three ranks of 5 or more models in your unit; the result is the number of enemy models has become entangled (distributed as hits from shooting, but only affecting models that are allowed to strike). However, for each natural 1 rolled on these dice, the Netters have managed to cast the nets amongst their own ranks and entangle a member of their own unit instead. A model that has been entangled suffers a -1 penalty to their A (this applies to both the rider and the mount) until the end of the close combat round.
sharedRules.name: Netters

description: Orc Brutes may re-roll failed To Hit rolls against Monstrous Infantry, Monstrous Beasts, Monstrous Cavalry and Monsters.
sharedRules.name: Duff Up da Big Thing

description: Nasty Skulkers have Always Strikes First and Armour Piercing (1) on turns they successfully charge an enemy in the flank or rear.
sharedRules.name: Surprise!

description: Characters may only join units of the same race (such as Orc, Savage Orc, Black Orc, Goblin, Forest Goblin, Night Goblin or Snotling). Black Orc characters may still join units of Orcs, however.
sharedRules.name: Greenskin Races

characteristics.$text: Multiple Wounds (D3). The Flinger can fire even if the Arachnarok Spider moves, but not if it marches. Any unit hit by a Flinger has Always Strikes Last until the end of its next turn. A misfire result means that the Flinger may not shoot this turn.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

sharedProfiles.name: 01-02 (Curse of da Bad Moon)
sharedProfiles.typeName: Curse of da Bad Moon Chart

sharedProfiles.name: 03-04 (Curse of da Bad Moon)
sharedProfiles.typeName: Curse of da Bad Moon Chart

sharedProfiles.name: 05-06 (Curse of da Bad Moon)
sharedProfiles.typeName: Curse of da Bad Moon Chart

characteristics.$text: Your opponent places the template anywhere on the table. It then scatters and inflicts damage exactly as described. The spell then ends.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: The spell ends without further effect.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Place the template again, as described. After resolving the effects of this stomp, roll again on this table.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: One enemy Wizard within range suffers a S 4 hit that inflicts Multiple Wounds (D3), which Ignores Armour saves.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: One enemy Wizard within range suffers a S 4 hit that inflicts Multiple Wounds (D3), which Ignores Armour saves.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Targets all Orc units (of any kind) that are in range, including the Shaman himself. The target units may re-roll To Hit rolls in close combat until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Place the small template within range of the Shaman. It then scatters D6", maintaining the same facing. All models hit by the template suffer a S 6 hit with Multiple Wounds (D3). If the spell is boosted roll a dice and consult the Foot of Gork table after resolving the effects of the spell.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: The target unit gains +1 S until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Extend a straight line, within the Shaman's forward arc and directly away from his base. Any model whose base falls under the line suffers a S 4 hit.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Extend a straight line, within the Shaman's forward arc and directly away from his base. Any model whose base falls under the line suffers a S 4 hit.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: For each friendly Orc (any type) unit in close combat within range of the Shaman, he adds +1 to his casting roll. Conversely, for each friendly Orc unit fleeing within range of the caster, he suffers -1 to his casting roll.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Affects all friendly Orc units (of any type) with 5 or more models within range. The target units will immediately make a move using Random Movement (2D6) towards the nearest enemy unit within Line of Sight  if no enemy units are within Line of Sight, they will move directly forward instead. Note that no unit may be moved more than once per Magic phase with this spell.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Inflicts D6 S 5 hits for every friendly unit of 5 or more Orc models (of any race) within 6" of the caster.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: The closer the target is to the caster, the more powerful the attack will be: if the target is within 6" of the caster, it suffers 2D6 S 5 Hits; if the target is between 6" and 12" away, it instead suffers D6 S 5 Hits; if the target is more than 12" away, it only suffers D3 S 5 Hits.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text:
Targets Orcs (of any type).  The unit adds +1 M to any charge move it makes, and gains +1 To Hit in close
combat until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units of Orcs (of any type) within range.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Target an unengaged unit. This unit may immediately make a normal Fly move (not march) as if it was the Remaining Moves phase.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: The target unit suffers D6 S 5 which Ignores Armour Saves and is stunned by the deafening roar. The target unit halves all their Movement and is subject to Always Strikes Last until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Targets Orcs (of any type). Your opponent must re-roll all To Hit rolls of 6 that target the unit with missile attacks and in close combat until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units of Orcs (of any type) within range.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Remains in play. Uses the small round template. Once the template is placed, the player then nominates the direction in which The Evil Sun will move. To determine how many inches the template moves, roll an artillery dice and multiply it by the number of Orc units (of any kind) within 6" of the template's original position. If the result on the artillery dice is a misfire, centre the template on the caster and roll a scatter dice. The template then moves D6" in the direction shown (if you roll a Hit! use the little arrow shown on the Hit! symbol). Any model under or passed over by the template suffers a S 5 hit. In subsequent turns, The Evil Sun travels in a random direction and moves a number of inches equal to the roll on an artillery dice multiplied by the number of Orc units (of any kind) within 6" of the template. If a misfire is rolled in subsequent turns, The Evil Sun is removed.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Targets a single enemy model (even a character in a unit). Roll a D6; on a 1 it has no effect, on a 2 to 3 that model suffers one Wound, on a 4 to 5 it suffers D3 Wounds and on a 6 it suffers D6 Wounds. These Wounds have Ignores Armour Saves. Each time a model is slain by Squiggly Curse, you can add +D3 to any further casting attempts made by the caster this Magic Phase.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: The target unit must re-roll successful To Hit rolls (in shooting and close combat) and armour saves until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Targets Goblins (of any type). The target unit gains Natural Armour (6+) until the start of the caster's next magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units of Goblins (of any type).within range.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Targets Goblins (of any type). The target unit gains Poisoned Attacks and Regeneration (6+) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. If the unit already has Poisoned Attacks, the spell will boost its venom so that they wound the target automatically on a To Hit roll of 6. Boosted version affects all friendly units of Goblins (of any type) within range.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: The target unit suffers 3D6 S 1 Hits with Poisoned Attacks.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Can be cast on any terrain feature within range. Until the start of the caster's next Magic phase, the target counts as Dangerous Terrain for all non-flying movement and in addition, units cannot march while within it. This spell has no effect on Forest Goblins.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text:
Targets Goblins (of any type). The target unit may immediately make a Move as if it were the Remaining
Moves phase.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: When a Spell of da Little Waaagh! is successfully cast, and after its effects have been resolved, roll a D6. On a roll of 1-4 nothing happens, but on a roll of 5-6 you may take one dispel dice from the opponent's dispel pool and add it to your power pool. If there are no dice left in the opponent's dispel pool, then this lore attribute has no effect.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: When a Spell of da Bad Moon is successfully cast, and after its effects have been resolved, roll a D6. On a roll of 1-4 nothing happens, but on a roll of 5-6 you may take one dispel dice from the opponent's dispel pool and add it to your power pool. If there are no dice left in the opponent's dispel pool, then this lore attribute has no effect.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: When a Spell of da Spider God is successfully cast, and after its effects have been resolved, roll a D6. On a roll of 1-4 nothing happens, but on a roll of 5-6 you may take one dispel dice from the opponent's dispel pool and add it to your power pool. If there are no dice left in the opponent's dispel pool, then this lore attribute has no effect.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Affects all enemy units within range of the caster. The target units suffer -1 To Hit with missile attacks and in close combat until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. This spell has no affect on models with Immunity (Psychology). Boosted version targets all enemy units within range.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Targets Goblins (of any race). The target unit's close combat attacks have Armour Piercing (1) and can re-roll all failed To Hit and To Wound rolls when attacking in close combat against an enemy's flank or rear until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units of Goblins (of any type) within range.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Targets a single unengaged friendly unit. Remove a model from the front rank of the unit and place it anywhere within 3D6"/6D6" of its original position, facing in any direction. Remove the remainder of the unit from the battlefield and form them up around the first model so that the unit keeps its original formation and the first model maintains its original position in the unit (if the unit comprised just one model, such as a chariot or character, then this step is unnecessary). Models from the unit cannot be placed in impassable terrain, nor may they be placed within 1" of any other unit.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: The target unit may re-roll all failed armour saves and Ward saves until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: The target unit must re-roll any of its To Hit, To Wound and armour save rolls of 6 (in shooting and close combat) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Targets a single enemy model (even a character in a unit). The target suffers a S 5 hit.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Targets a single enemy character (even a character in a unit). The target suffers D3 S 4 Hits which Ignores Armour Saves. If the target has one or more magic items, randomly select one of them  that item is stolen on the roll of 3+. If the caster does not already have a magic item of this type they can now use it, otherwise it is destroyed.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Targets a single enemy model (even a character in a unit). The target must pass an I test or suffer D6 S 10 hits.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Affects units of Squigs (of any type) within range. The target units add an additional D6" to any move they make in the Movement phase (except Fleeing) and when pursuing; as well as gain Frenzy until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Targets all friendly units within range. Until the beginning of the caster's next Magic phase, enemies suffer -1 To Hit with missile weapons against these units. All models in any enemy unit that charges into base contact with the Shaman or the unit he is with while the spell is in effect must take a Dangerous Terrain test.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Roll a D6. The target unit immediately reduces its M and I by this number (to a minimum of 1), until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Troops with Random Movement reduce the number of dice they roll by D3 (to a minimum of 1D6), and their I by D6.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Pick one friendly Goblin unit (of any type) within 12" of the caster; the target unit suffers D6 S 4 Hits if this friendly unit has a lower Unit Strength than 20, 2D6 S 4 Hits if the friendly unit has Unit Strength of 20 to 30, and 3D6 S 4 Hits if the friendly unit has a Unit Strength over 30. These Hits have Armour Piercing (1).
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Place the small template with the centre anywhere within this range; it scatters and inflicts damage like a Stone Thrower. If a misfire is rolled, centre the template over the caster instead.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Uses the small/large round template. Once the template is placed, the caster nominates the direction in which it will move. Roll 4D6 to determine how many inches the template moves. In subsequent turns the template will move 3D6" in a random direction. Any model under or passed over by the template is cursed, and must pass a characteristic test or take a wound which Ignores Armour Saves. The type of characteristic test is determined by rolling on the Curse of da Bad Moon chart. Roll once each Magic phase, just before moving the template, and apply the result to all models affected by the curse in that Magic phase.
characteristics.name: Details

catalogue.name: Orcs & Goblins
catalogue.authorContact: Contact me on the Warhammer Armies Project Discord (1st link) or on the BSData Developers Discord (2nd link)
